text: Allothrissops is an extinct genus of prehistoric bony fish belonging to the Ichthyodectiformes. == Description == Allothrissops has an elongated body, a deeply forked tail with a lower lobe slightly longer than the upper one, a short skull and short jaws. == Fossils == Allothrissops mesogaster.JPG|Allothrissops mesogaster Allothrissops 1.jpg Allothrissops 2.jpg Specimen at Natural History Museum, Gothenburg 12.jpg|Specimen at Natural History Museum, Gothenburg Allothrissops salmoneus 35.jpg|Allothrissops salmoneus FOS430.jpg == Species == * Allothrissops mesogaster Agassiz, 1834 * Allothrissops salmoneus de Blainville, 1818 (type) * Allothrissops regleyi Thiolli√®re, 1854 == References == # "Fossilworks: Allothrissops" . fossilworks.org. Retrieved 17 December 2021. Category:Extinct fish Category:Bony fish Category:Ichthyodectiformes
title: Allothrissops
